results.title: Adventure Island: The Diamond Tree
results.creator_credit: Godfrey Philipp, John Michael Howson and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Ho ho, ho ho, its far away we go, to a land that’s far across the sea. Hey hey, hey hey, for a little while we’ll stay, and be home in time for tea……..

The popular long-running children’s program ‘Adventure Island’ is set in the kingdom of Diddley-Dum-Diddley, and follows the continuing adventures of Liza, Clown, Mrs Flower Potts, Percy and Dodo Panda and their friends.

In this episode, a magical plant produces diamond flowers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Godfrey Philipp, John Michael Howson and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: 7.30 Report: The Dismissal
results.brief_description:
On the eve of the thirtieth anniversary of the dismissal of the Whitlam government, a special edition of the ABC’s national nightly current affairs program, ‘7:30 Report’ takes an in-depth look at the events of 1975.

The program features interviews with both Gough Whitlam and Malcolm Fraser who comment on the events of 1975, discuss the possibility of 4 year fixed terms for both the House of Representatives and the Senate and reflect upon the politics of modern Australia, and upon each other.

Broadcast on 10th November, 2005.

results.title: Bellbird: Episode 205
results.creator_credit: Keith Wilkes, Oscar Whitbread and ABC
results.brief_description:
The ABC produced 1693 episodes of ‘Bellbird’ and the series ran for 10 years, until 1977. The series was a huge hit in rural and regional Australia because it dealt with the concerns of people living on the land and the dynamics of small country town life.
Episode 205 was broadcast on 1 January 1967.

results.title: The Genie from down under: larceny
results.creator_credit: Brendan Maher, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Bruce helps Otto and Conrad get the opal because he thinks they will help him return to Australia. Instead, the von Meisters sell it for 25,000 pounds. It’s now up to the genies to sort the mess out.

results.title: The Genie from down under: customs
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Swan, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Penelope, Lady Diana and Miss Mossop are arrested by a Customs Officer when they return to England with 20 million pounds provided by the genies. That exact amount has just gone missing from the Royal Mint.

results.title: The Genie from down under: good cop, bad genie
results.creator_credit: Brendan Maher, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Penelope is desperate to win the Cross Country and she does - without any help from the genies. Penelope wishes that Conrad could see her success. He does - but not quite how Penelope would have liked.

results.title: The Genie from down under: it's my opal and I'll cry if I want to
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Swan, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Tour operator, Otto von Meister, and his nephew, Conrad, arrive at Townes Downs with a load of tourists. When he learns about the opal Otto recalls that it belonged to their family years before and he and Conrad are desperate to get it back.
results.title_for_label: The Genie from down under: it’s my opal and I’ll cry if I want to

results.title: The Genie from down under: wishing and hoping
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When upper class English girl Penelope Townes finds a magic opal which contains two Australian genies, Bruce and his son Baz, she thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have anything she wants. Bruce, however, has other ideas.

results.title: Grandma Jessie
results.brief_description: In this very personal story, Stephanie King pays tribute to her Grandma Jessie and reflects on the influence her upbringing by her grandmother has had on her own education and outlook.
